Package org.engine

Class GameLoop

java.lang.Object
org.engine.GameLoop
public class GameLoop
extends java.lang.Object
The GameLoop class handles all actions performed by the game engine while the game is running. It contains a thread which runs continuously and performs the required updates and rendering on all the other components of the game. The thread seeks to achieve a number of 60 updates/frames drawn every second.

    Nested Classes

    Different states the program can be in.

  • Field Details

    • running

      private static boolean running
      Flags the thread as running. Setting it to false will stop the thread and subsequently close the game.

    • updates

      private static int updates
      Counts the number of updates performed in case some delay has occurred and catching up is required.

    • MAX_UPDATES

      private static final int MAX_UPDATES
      Maximum number of updates that can be performed when "catching up"
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

      private static long lastUpdateTime
      Keeps track of the last time an update was performed

    • world

      Currently active game world, acts as the current level

    • targetTime

      private static int targetTime
      Nanoseconds it should take to update and render a frame in case everything goes well

    • GameLoop

      public GameLoop()

  • Method Details

    • start

      static void start()
      Initializes and starts the thread

    • updateDelta

      public static float updateDelta()
      Returns the update delta of the game loop (i.e. the time an update/render cycle should normally take, in seconds) Can be useful for some calculations regarding movement/animation speed

    • getWorld

      public static World getWorld()
      Getter for the currently active world, which needs to be accessed in several places across the game engine
      Returns:
      currently active world object

    • getState

      public static GameLoop.STATES getState()
      Returns the current state of the game (whether it's in the menu or in game, etc.)
      Returns:
      variable of type STATES denoting the current state

    • newGame

      public static void newGame()
      Instantiates a new World object and sets it as the currently active world

    • reset

      private static void reset()
      Resets the camera and clears the game world. Automatically called when exiting to menu

    • setState

      public static void setState​(GameLoop.STATES state)
      Changes the current state to a given one. Also calls the reset() method.
      Parameters:
      state - variable of the STATES enum defined in this class
